ADVENTURE_HOOK: {{ADVENTURE_HOOK}}, action must be performed during the event "{{EVENT}}"
investigate Theft of {{OBJECT}} belonging to {{ENCOUNTER_INTELLIGENT}} at {{LOCATION}}{{HERE_OR_THERE}}
ANIMAL: Granjoro Jellyfish <mark>(10' diameter, look it up)</mark>
BOOK_MAGIC_TYPE: Other or multiple magical disciplines Spell[s]: {{SPELL_OTHER}}

CASTLE_CACHTICE_INHABITANT.18: March Hare about to deliver message from House of Hearts to Pale King
CASTLE_CACHTICE_INHABITANT.19: Hatter delivering message from Pale King
CASTLE_CACHTICE_INHABITANT.20: Knight delivering message to Colorless Queen
CASTLE_CACHTICE_INHABITANT.21: Red Bishop delivering message from Red King
CASTLE_CACHTICE_INHABITANT.41: Old relative of Queen or King
CASTLE_CACHTICE_INHABITANT.47: Keymaster <mark>(has key to each room except Hall of Hissing Statues)</mark>
CASTLE_CACHTICE_INHABITANT.63: Sphinx <mark>(lurking, trying to get into library)</mark>

COMPLICATION: Spatial distortion: walk away from target location to reach it
Time distortion: 25% of rounds are undone afterward <mark>(Warning: this is a pain to Referee, but fun)</mark>
Time distortion: move forward by staying still and occupying square

Name loss. <mark>Anyone passing through this square must make a Wisdom check or else lose their name. They will not be able to remember it, neither will anyone else, and no targeted spell or ritual will affect them (including beneficial ones)- though area effect spells still can. One can regain one's name by finding a village and being rechristened (their real name will be remembered) or by committing a deed resulting in gaining at least half of the experience points needed to reach the next level and renaming yourself after the deed (Frederic the Larcenous, Morgotte Hogslayer, etc). One cannot gain levels or be healed by Clerical magic without a name</mark>
Spatial distortion: crossing square eastward leads north, west leads south and vice versa
Sunlight does not reach this square
DIAMOND_JOB: Old relative of Queen or King
DOING_CARE: Secretly or overtly controls a powerful faction in the Interior
Demonstrates extensive knowledge of much that is hidden- and will reveal more in exchange for aid
Has a bad temper, and a map of the local Interior
Is on good terms with powerful creature in the Interior and can get the characters past it
Has oracular powers or is a Cleric with a few Cure Moderate Wounds up his/her embroidered sleeves
Is in a position to offer the characters a sizable monetary reward once they are safely out of the Interior
Is delivering a message to one of the kings or queens and if they are interrupted the characters will suffer
Is valuable if captured alive and brought to a wealthy patron
Knows the code to interpret the message s/he carries
DOING_RELATIONSHIP: Is hunting with the aid of {{ANIMAL_ENCOUNTER}}
DOING_WANT: Wants to get into or out of Interior
Wants revenge on {{ENCOUNTER_INTERIOR}} in the Interior
Wants a fantastic treasure hoard they believe to be located nearby
Wants the character with the highest Charisma
Wants a magic item believed to be in the Interior; <mark>either one you already put in there, or a regular item that this loser thinks is magical</mark>
Wants to desecrate one of the altars
Wants to stir up dissent within occupying factions of {{ENCOUNTER_INTERIOR}} in the Interior
Wants to locate the rest of his/her party
Wants to invent preposterous but plausible objectives to keep the characters busy while s/he bumps them off one by one
Wants to slay and replace the head of faction of {{ENCOUNTER_INTERIOR}} in the Interior

EVENT.10: Fierce battle between Red and Heart forces in square {{RANDOM_HEX}}
EVENT.15: Infamous duel between {{ENCOUNTER_INTELLIGENT}} and {{NAMED_NPC}} at {{LOCATION}} in square {{RANDOM_HEX}}
EVENT.23: {{OBJECT}} stolen at Heart Queen's croquet game
EVENT.35: {{NAMED_NPC}} slain in duel with {{ENCOUNTER_INTELLIGENT}} at {{LOCATION}} in square {{RANDOM_HEX}}
EVENT.37: {{NAMED_NPC}} to be executed by {{HOUSE}} after trial
EVENT.39: {{ENCOUNTER_INTELLIGENT}} slain in Rite of Engagement at {{LOCATION}} in square {{RANDOM_HEX}}
EVENT.42: Massive battle- disastrous for both Heart and Red sides- forecluded in square {{RANDOM_HEX}}
EVENT.43: Massive battle- disastrous for all four sides- forecluded in square {{RANDOM_HEX}}
EVENT.44: Negotiations between House of Hearts and Pale House
EVENT.45: Negotiations between House of Hearts and Colorless House
EVENT.46: Negotiations between Red House and Pale House
EVENT.47: Negotiations between Red House and Colorless House
EVENT.48: Combined Pale and Colorless forces attack Red House on field of battle in square {{RANDOM_HEX}}
EVENT.49: Combined Pale and Colorless forces attack House of Hearts on field of battle in square {{RANDOM_HEX}}
EVENT.50: Combined Heart and Pale forces attack Red House in square {{RANDOM_HEX}}
EVENT.51: Combined Heart and Colorless forces attack Red House in square {{RANDOM_HEX}}
EVENT.52: Combined Red and Pale forces attack Hearts in square {{RANDOM_HEX}}
EVENT.53: Combined Red and Colorless forces attack Hearts in square {{RANDOM_HEX}}
EVENT.55: Jabberwock sighted in square {{RANDOM_HEX}}; hunting party sent from {{HOUSE}} to capture it
EVENT.56: {{ENCOUNTER_INTELLIGENT}} framed by Tizala (Red Bride) for slaying another bride
EVENT.57: Red Bride Ildana caught attempting to slay Red King
EVENT.58: Pale King has spotted the Unicorn in square {{RANDOM_HEX}} and is pursuing it
EVENT.59: Pale King has spotted the Sphinx in square {{RANDOM_HEX}} and is pursuing it
EVENT.60: Nyvian, the Colorless Queen, has been seen having tea with the Hatter
EVENT.62: Nyvian, the Colorless Queen, has been seen with the Red Bride, Tizala
EVENT.63: Nyvian, the Colorless Queen, has been seen with the Red Bride, Ildanna
EVENT.64: Rabbit found dead at {{LOCATION}} in square {{RANDOM_HEX}} with enigmatic communique, suggesting betrayal of the House of Hearts
EVENT.65: Cheshire Cat seen in the halls of the Looking Glass Palace
EVENT.66: Hatter on trial in the Card Castle
EVENT.67: Hatter has advised the Pale King to join the Red King
EVENT.68: Hatter has advised the Pale King to join the Heart Queen
EVENT.69: Hatter has advised the Pale King to join the Colorless Queen
EVENT.70: Hatter has fixed his watch and now his power is frightening
EVENT.71: Hare has opened negotiations between the Pale House and Hearts
EVENT.72: Doormouse found dead at {{LOCATION}} in square {{RANDOM_HEX}} with mysterious message to Knave
EVENT.74: Strange new recipe discovered at {{LOCATION}} in square {{RANDOM_HEX}}
EVENT.75: A Decapitated Lord has been recapitated
EVENT.76: One of the Pale King's recipe books is missing; the Knave is suspected
EVENT.77: Knight of each house found dead in a locked room in square {{RANDOM_HEX}} with the Pseudoturtle
EVENT.79: King of Hearts executed by Heart Queen. Her forces are expected to suffer on the field of battle
EVENT.81: {{NAMED_NPC}} discovered in compromisingly intimate congress with {{ENCOUNTER_INTELLIGENT}}
EVENT.85: Red King's forces have established a small fortress in square {{RANDOM_HEX}}
EVENT.89: Heart Queen's forces have established a small fortress in square {{RANDOM_HEX}}
EVENT.91: Scribes say a strange and valuable {{OBJECT}} is located somewhere in the interior beneath square {{RANDOM_HEX}}: all sides are scrambling through the interiors to find it
EVENT.92: Plague of foot and mouth disease ravaging horses on both sides
EVENT.97: Time distortion freezes time in square {{RANDOM_HEX}} for one week, d4 {{ENCOUNTER_INTELLIGENT}}[s] caught in it
EVENT.98: Time distortion causes reverse battle between Heart and Red forces in square {{RANDOM_HEX}}, other houses scramble to use their knowledge of the fight (whose outcome they know) to un-save certain enemies
EVENT.99: Heart battle plan secretly discovered by Red forces
EVENT.100: Red battle plan secretly discovered by Heart forces

FOREST_LANDMARK: Stitch in space- Settlement in the distance
Section of interior {{INTERIOR_ROOM}} filled in with water
GARDEN_LANDMARK: Tall tower <mark>see 12-20 miles in every direction</mark>
Small fortified section of exposed interior {{INTERIOR_ROOM}}
Section of interior {{INTERIOR_ROOM}} filled in with water
GUEST_ATTRIBUTE: Hairless (or skinless if base creature has skin or if you're bored with that)
Made of volcanic stone (lava through cracks)
Extra arm (or 2 arms if base creature has none)
Vertical symmetry (built like a king, queen or jack playing card, with extra, inverted head and arms where legs should be)
Elongated: d12+7' tall but skinny and fragile looking
Barely mobile: fat, d20' tall, d20'+4 feet in diameter, moves 1 foot per round. {{GUEST_POWER}}. {{GUEST_POWER}}
Amphibious: a sea Guest- gills and scales etc
Is pair of identical twin Guests, half stats each, powers belong to one or the other
Faceless- if already faceless, then limbless
Headless- if already headless, then has random head
Divided: left half and right half have separate attributes- roll full complement separately
Quartered: 4 quarters of body have separate attributes- roll full complement separately
Missing d4 limbs typical of base creature
Missing mouth- if already mouthless, has mouth
Missing d2 eyes-if already eyeless, has 1 eye
d4 limbs in wrong places- if this is not applicable, has d4 arms/legs
Mane like a lion or frilled lizard
Crawls if base creature doesn't, upright if base creature does
Facial features rearranged. If featureless, has a face now
Walks as if gravity pointed toward whatever wall Guest stands on
Unborn: still foetal or in egg
Shadow moves independently but stays attached, has same stats as the Guest
Covered in acidic slime, leaves trail
Body is elongated but has holes in it, like swiss cheese or torn dough
{{OBJECT}} visibly embedded in-/worn on- body is power source- regenerates d6hp per round unless this thing is removed, in which case it probably is banished
Centaur ({{GUEST_CENTAUR}}). If already a centaur, then has a torso on either end
Appears with neck broken, spears through it, daggers in its face, crucified or otherwise physically mortified
Visible internal organ- heart, brain, etc
Mandalaform: Creature has 4 torsos joined in the center
Guest can assume two forms: the one rolled so far and another one which is an ordinary human, demihuman or domestic animal with one minor irregularity (missing finger, heterochromatic eyes, etc)
Crouches like a toad, maybe legs to match
Sheathed in ornate/ ominous plate armor that hides its form
Elongated proboscis-face like the Spy vs. Spy guys or an anteater- with long tongue
Animal face if humanoid body, humanoid face if otherwise
GUEST_CATEGORY: The Unholy (Agent of Temptation). Essentially human in shape{{GUEST_UNHOLY_TAIL}}{{GUEST_UNHOLY_LEGS}}{{GUEST_UNHOLY_CLAWS}}{{GUEST_UNHOLY_WINGS}}{{GUEST_UNHOLY_HORNS}}{{GUEST_UNHOLY_HEAD}}{{GUEST_UNHOLY_ATTRIBUTES}}{{GUEST_UNHOLY_POWERS}}. {{GUEST_PURPOSE}}
GUEST_POWER: All within 20' radius must save or be overcome with desire to kill other random nearby character (50% chance of wanting to eat them, too)
Breathes fire
Constant screaming causes sonic damage (d4hp per round) and may disrupt spells
Invisible except in total darkness
Automatic gaze weapon ({{GUEST_GAZE_WEAPON}})
Automatic touch weapon ({{GUEST_GAZE_WEAPON}})
Can remove own body parts and throw them
Constriction attack (ability to stretch if necessary)

All within 20' radius must save or fall in love with Guest. Good Clerics or Paladins may choose either to automatically succeed or to give everyone in the area a +2 bonus to this save (not both, though)
3-word command spell (save optional)
Charm
Powerful wind constantly blows toward Guest
Vegetation dies and stone crumbles wherever it walks
Speaks only in whispers. All sound nearby is deadened
Everyone with in a 30'radius must save or begin weeping
The air in its wake is filled with deadly vapors. All within 10' must save or be poisoned
It is always raining in the area around this Guest
All nonintelligent animals in a 100' radius die instantly when Guest appears
All nonintelligent animals in a 50' radius become corrupted and obey Guest's commands
Dozens of small verminous {{GUEST_VERMIN}} appear out of ground when creature is summoned
Acidic blood
Tiny fat demons for blood (tend to spray when cut)
No-one may tell the truth within 20' of the Guest
No-one may lie within 20' of the Guest
All 0-levels or commoners within 50' become suicidal
Any dead characters in the area automatically rise as zombies or skeletons according to their level of decomposition and obey Guest
Confusion 20'radius for d4 rounds
Breathes hideous cone of vomit and gore
Rusting aura- 5'
Corrodes faith- Guest's attacks do permanent damage to target's willpower-based saves
Grants 1 wish per week. Twists wishes if possible within the wording and, if not, takes a terrible price in return
Guest's attacks appear to do no damage, but in fact inflict equivalent damage on target's loved ones. This is revealed in dreams
Guest knows all of characters' sins and those of their closest confidants and will relate them, psychically or verbally, to anyone in earshot
Guest's voice issues from mouth of nearby intelligent creature- the weakest, preferably a child. Creature's voice issues from mouth of Guest
Damage to Guest hurts nearby target instead and vice versa
Can cause targets' mouth to fill with worms
Automatic spell reflection on any caster whose level is less than Guest's HD (arcane spells only- Cleric spells work fine)

Full of other, smaller Guests. Killing the creature or scoring a critical hit on it causes it to burst open and they run out. They are 18" tall and identical, of the same order as the parent and possess d4 attributes. There are 3d6 of them
100' aura of putrefaction
Vulnerable only to magic and blessed weapons. Weapons blessed by an antithetical priest gain +2 to hit Guest
Unholy touch causes Clerics to lose d4 spells and Paladins to lose special abilities for d10 rounds
Blood spilled from a Paladin or good Cleric heals d8 damage, killing a Paladin or an antithetical Cleric heals all damage
Spits out own teeth like darts. 2d6 damage. If a toothless creature, it shoots acidic spores
Swallows victims whole
Cast Web of Thorns (as Web but moving out of it causes damage)
Touch {{GUEST_AGING}}. Level stays the same, but stats are affected
Can teleport by walking into a shadow on solid surface and re-emerging from any shadow within 100 yards 2 rounds later

All works of human craft or art within 100 yards become worse. Paintings become brushy and ham-fisted, the lines of poems chime awkwardly and, more to the point, armor doesn't fit right (armor becomes 2 steps worse) and weaponwork fails (weapons break on any fumble). Effect is permanent
Anything blessed, specially holy to a given faith (like a church), or possessed by a Cleric bursts into flame within 20'
Can cast False Seeing- targets save or see everything as the opposite of the way it actually is for 24 hours starting after the Guest leaves or is killed
Touch causes target to vomit up everything s/he has eaten in last 4 days along with any constituent nutrients metabolized in the ensuing time. Target is now at -2 Constitution and ravenously hungry
Guest hears confession: asks characters to recount the past week's sins. If they refuse, lie, or have no sins, they take 2d6 cold damage

Guest spends one minute delivering prophecies on all creatures present. Guest is immune to harm (and takes no other action) during this minute. Creatures may take no action, however oblique, against the Guest during this time
Inverted howl: Guest's screech causes 1hp damage per foot away from the Guest, up to 100 yards. Targets touching Guest are immune. Save negates the first time only
Slow aura 20'radius
Creatures lose their balance in 20' radius, need a Dexterity check to stay upright each round

Grapples target, reaches into target's mouth, pulls soul out in the form of a small animal of a type appropriate to the character, made of a metal appropriate to that person's deeds (gold, silver, tin, etc). The soul is indestructible but the character will fail all saves and cannot be beneficially affected by any spell until it is retrieved and re-swallowed
Will offer to heal fallen foes (Cure Moderate Wounds) in exchange for their soul. (Effect to be decided by Referee)
Lava for blood
Food in 1100 yard radius becomes poisonous (only detectable by magic)
Touch causes hideous uncontrollable laughter
Poisoned bite, claw or weapon
Wounding this Guest causes tentacle to grow out of wound and attack on same round
Wounding this Guest causes Guest to gain additional attribute
Minor baleful Polymorph (subtractive): can cause target to save or lose a finger, an eye, a tongue, etc
Minor baleful Polymorph (additive): can cause target to save or grow clamping fingers over mouth, skin over eyes, etc
Minor baleful Polymorph (tranformative): can cause target's finger to turn into rat, arm into snake, etc
Dessicating touch
Touch causes target to forget an important thing

Can transfer knowledge of the awful realities of the universe into target's mind: target is immobilized for a number of rounds equal to Intelligence minus 7, gains 1 point of Wisdom, but must save vs. Magic or go insane for a week
Touch causes target to take 1 point of damage per creature target has slain in last week. 1 extra point for each intelligent target
Wounds inflicted by Guest cannot be healed until Guest is slain
Anyone within 10' weeps blood: -2 to hit and lose 1hp per round
Vegetation within 20' grows wild and blood thirsty
Null inertia field 10'-arrows drop to the ground, normal melee attacks are at -2 and do -2 damage until the Guest is grappled
Shrieks of pain heal Guest- if it can cause a target to howl in pain, it regains d6hp

A 100 yard radius area is afflicted by temporal flux, causing everything except the Guest and its foes to become as it was/will be... (standard option) in the age of dinosaurs or equivalent (you-did-a-lot-of-world-building-and-want-to-show-off-option) / back to the age of whenever you think would be an interesting time for the characters to visit (gonzo option) / 2,000 years into the future (steampunk fetishist option) in the Victorian era

Guest is healed when another creature within 30' inflicts a wound on an innocent. However, Guest is bound to serve the inflicter for a number of rounds equal to the damage inflicted + d6-3 rounds (rolled secretly by Referee). (Damage cannot be self-inflicted- one creature must wound another)
Touch causes all missiles fired within 100 yards to hit target until Guest is slain
Can curse one word per round by saying it in a mocking voice. Any creature saying that word or writing it takes d8 points of damage until Guest is destroyed. (Guest is immune)

Can curse one action per combat round or 6 seconds by performing that action while swaying lewdly (swinging a sword, casting a spell, walking, etc). Any creature performing that action takes d8 damage until Guest is destroyed. (Guest is immune)

Can curse a patch of ground by wounding someone on it- anyone in a 10' radius of where the foe fell is wracked with pain and takes d8 damage per round. Effect remains until Guest is slain. (Guest is immune)
Can cause target to fall madly in love with next being s/he sees other than those present at moment of casting. Effect is permanent and can only be lifted via Remove Curse, etc

Maze spell 2x/day. A creature may elect to spend extra time in the maze (max time for his/ her Int. level + 1 round) and, if so, and if s/he either succeeds in an Int. check at -10 or goes to the right place in a maze the Referee has prepared in advance for this purpose, may find the Guest's soul, in the form of a bizarre relic or talisman and, once s/he returns to the material plane, may use it to bind the Guest to his/her will
Organic matter (including leather armor, straps, cotton) decays, rots, and is eaten by moths in a 10' radius around Guest

Can cause one enemy attack or spell per combat round to strike a target of its choosing, including the attacker. May use this as an "interrupt" action but this is the Guest's "attack" action for the turn
Can spit a viscous goo which solidifies with the strength of a Web spell in a small area the size of a fist. This can be used to pin a foot to the ground, stick a sword to its sheath, etc. 20' range
Can imitate any action performed by an opponent, unless that opponent is a Paladin or Cleric. Attack rolls, spell dice results, etc. will be the same

Can steal a melee weapon from a foe on a successful to-hit roll. If successful, the Guest may attack with that weapon (from next turn onwards) until it succeeds. A successful hit indicates the weapon does normal damage but is also stuck fast inside the opponent and can't be removed without a Remove Curse or similar spell. The weapon does d4hp of damage each time the target moves

Guest asks all present, in turn, "Will you slay me?" All must answer yes or no ("I don't know" isn't an option, however, secretly, saying that another creature will is)- any foe saying "No" will take d10 damage from demoralization and is -2 to all saves if they attack the creature, though they will gain double XP if they actually do slay the Guest (landing the killing blow), any foe saying "Yes" will take d20 damage after the battle ends if they were wrong, and anyone saying someone else's name will take d10 damage if they were wrong and will gain +25% XP if they were right

Guest causes all who do not save vs. Magic within 100 yards to see Guest's foes as Guests and attack them on sight. Immunity to the effect is conferred by having crossed a river in company of a fellow target- so in most cases player characters cannot be turned against each other, but all local NPCs will turn against them
Time becomes terrible. Traversing each grisly new second is like crawling over a new desert. Anyone who can see the Guest begins to lose one point of Constitution per round until it is destroyed
The air around the Guest is a cloud of microscopic, razor-sharp particles, causing 1hp damage per 6 feet moved. 18' radius. (Guest is immune)
Touch causes target to dance in an unseemly way, unable to perform any other action (aside from half-speed movement) until s/he saves against Magic at -5
All children within 10 miles scream at the top of their lungs continuously. May or may not have mechanical effects, depending on the proximity of the children
The Guest's shadow burns all it touches (other than the Guest) for 2d6hp of damage
Guest spits volley of small knives, caltrops, shuriken, etc. Does d12 + (10 minus the number of feet targets are away) damage to all within a cone who do not save
Guest causes deluge of blood. The blood fills the room at 1' per round, or if outdoors, it begins to rain blood. Either way it's pretty distracting

Touch causes target's bones to decay- they lose 10% of their Dexterity and Constitution per round until they're a blob of skin-covered organs. Dispel Magic or Remove Curse negates the effect, killing or banishing the Guest stops it from getting worse

Guest announces it will annihilate a given target and devour their soul. It will attack only that target (at +2) until it succeeds. Each round it is prevented from attacking that target by another creature it will lose 1hp. It is at -2 to everything vs. any other target. If target is slain, Guest gains d4 HD and anyone who tried and failed to stop it will lose 50% of their hit points from morale damage and shame

GUEST_PURPOSE.2: Retrieve specific object from our reality
GUEST_PURPOSE.3: Slay individual who has broken a pact with another Guest
GUEST_PURPOSE.8: Advise powerful good or evil members of {{PROFESSION}} while disguised as an ordinary human, elf, etc., and secretly turn their efforts toward wickedness and ruin (can Polymorph Self d4 times per day)
GUEST_PURPOSE.9: Collect intelligence on the sins of humans and their ilk
GUEST_PURPOSE.10: Destroy or discredit powerful good creature/person
GUEST_PURPOSE.12: Use some nominally good thing- love, friendship, compassion, enlightenment- to sow strife

GUEST_TRUE_NAME_DESCRIPTION: of the Air, the Earth, and the Seas

GUEST_UNCREATED_INSANITY.25: . Causes insanity on sight (save or d10 rounds of effectively having Wisdom 1)

GUEST_VERMIN: skeletons of all animals that have died here
GUEST_WEAPON_ARMS: Hands on the end of chains

I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.52: *Engagement ring and semi-literate drafts of marriage-proposal speech <mark>with name of potential fiancee written in margins</mark>
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.55: *Miniature Slab of Hands <mark>(see Castle Poenari, room 35)</mark>
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.61: *Draft of a writ of decapitation from the Heart Queen
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.62: *Contract for mercenaries from a foreign land
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.63: *Deed of sale for an artwork (signed), <mark>suggesting the artwork's value to the new owner is vastly out of proportion to its size and quality</mark>
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.64: *Architectural sketches <mark>that make no sense, referring to a familiar building or room</mark>
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.65: *An unusual bird <mark>with moist wings and a beak 5 inches long, carefully wrapped, as if for delivery</mark>
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.67: *Journal, <mark>seemingly written by a pawn or servant, seething with regicidal fury against his or her own lord</mark>
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.70: *Ivory belt buckle shaped like a horse
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.71: *Instructions for making an unusual kind of shoe
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.77: *Locket <mark>containing a small engraving of a seemingly-unrelated NPC of a different House</mark>
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.78: *Ivory statuette of a crocodile. <mark>Will turn into a real crocodile if immersed</mark>
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.79: *Beautiful map of the Once Palace from years ago. <mark>Contains locations of long-forgotten pleasure domes, including ones once located where the characters are</mark>
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.80: *Looks similar to healing potions but it's actually a love potion. <mark>Drink it and fall in love with whoever last wounded you</mark>
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.81: *Ceremonial silver knife with a Colorless Bishop carved into the pierced blade. <mark>Specifically consecrated for an assassination attempt on the bishop by a mysterious cult</mark>
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.82: *Small carved figurine or chess piece of one of the characters, <mark>precise in every detail, 25 - 28mm tall. Purpose unknown</mark>
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.84: *Linked jewelry chains in the shape of a spider's web. <mark>Surprisingly strong</mark>
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.85: *Recipe for elephant-shaped cake <mark>involving three hit points of blood and 3 drops of sweat. When baked, it will know whatever the blood donor knows and will answer whatever questions about that information the sweat-donor asks. This information is in the recipe</mark>
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.86: *Small, elaborately carved stone sphere (or wheel) the size of a marble. <mark>If the head of a chess pawn of the appropriate color is removed and replaced with this sphere, the owner may control a single Red, Pale or Colorless Pawn until the next cock's crow. Works once</mark>
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.87: *A small vial of blue dust, <mark>breathing it causes victim to forget the last hour</mark>
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.88: *Tiny scale model of a gazebo in the Gardens made of gingerbread
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.90: *Jabberwock egg. <mark>2" long. A new Jabberwock will be born from this egg when the old one is slain</mark>
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.92: *Pair of small (3"x4") picture frames. <mark>Putting an object through one will make it come out of the other</mark>
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.93: *Valued lost shears of the Heart Queen' Coiffeuse
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.94: *Set of 12 small translucent, colored cubes <mark>that, when dropped in a body of water, produce a variety of different effects - bubbles, color change, soothing steam, pleasant hallucinations, etc</mark>
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.95: *Vial of "Mirror Water." <mark>When spilled, the puddle is a portal to a reversed dimension. If anyone attempts to walk across the puddle, an exact duplicate of themselves (same abilities, equipment, etc) will crawl out and attempt to kill them</mark>
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.98: *Croquet ball painted like a fat pig
I_SEARCH_THE_BODY.99: *Letter of introduction <mark>to a high-level NPC of a rival House extolling NPC's service to that House</mark>

LOCATION_FOREST.9: Stitch in space- Settlement in the distance

LOCATION_OTHER: {{LOCATION}} On Quiet Side of Looking Glass

Peak <mark>see extra 12-20 miles in all directions</mark>
Peak <mark>see extra 12-20 miles in all directions</mark>
Hill <mark>see extra 9 miles in all directions</mark>
Section of interior {{INTERIOR_ROOM}} filled in with water
NAMED_NPC_APPEARANCE: One-eyed, wheeled around in a chair
Crude, jocular, skin missing near jaw
Limp, opulent, carried everywhere on a palanquin
Wears bizarre cermonial crown, weak voice, thin-fingered
Sentimental, fragile, dressed in silver & white silks
Abrupt, impatient, wears long leather gloves
Wary, detached, thin, aged and lame
White-haired, talonlike hands, speaks in whispers
Dark-eyed, clever, has three silver teeth
NAMED_NPC_JOB: Controls spice trade from the East
Bribes maids for information on other nobles
Breeds and trains finest {{ANIMAL}}[s] on the continent
Has finest art collection in Voivodja
Collects powerful magical and occult items
Expert in gems and jewels
Owns majority of the best orchards on the continent
Breeds and trains the finest warhorses on the continent
Runs brothels all over the country
A recognized expert in the treatment of disturbed minds
The cavalry of their house is loyal to her above all others
Owns the land beneath all the breweries on the continent
Expert in the intricacies of Vornheim law
In charge of translations of foreign documents
Child of giants
Minister of {{ANIMAL}} catchers
Level 15 wizard
Minister of Imports and Licenses - oversees much of the administrative bureaucracy
Commands a formidable army of animal breeders and mutators
Court composer
Royal exorcist
Nobility in their house
Wife of house nobility, controls access to them
Popular in society due to his elaborate and decadent masked balls
Important society tastemaker
Charisma 18, enthralls nearly all who gaze upon her
Controls much of the trade in illicit substances in the country
Employs the finest chefs and cooks in Voivodja
"Queen of Riddles" - known for her mastery of obscure trivia
Is not native to Voivodja, travelled far and wide when she was younger and has stories of foreign lands
Spymaster to their monarch
Saved their house during the Battle of Ten Thousand {{ANIMAL}}
Skilled investigator, solved recent murder of nobility
Charisma 18, Wisdom 18
Court portraitist
Physician to their monarch
Controls trade in {{OBJECT}} and important mining interests
12th level cleric of Tiamat
Chief of the palace guard
Ambassador to Nornrik
Finest humorist in Voivodja - liked by nearly everyone. Collects jokes from around the world
Chief of their houses's militia
Chief adviser to their monarch
10th level witch
A lovely child, beloved throughout Voivodjan society
Major importer of silks and fabrics
Unimportant
All fear his power - his enemies are always exposed (or framed)
Chief of cartography
Renowned as an invincible duelist
NAMED_NPC_PERSONALITY: Pulls wings off exotic butterflies from distant lands
Drowns orphans in bathtub
Creates wax sculptures of dead loved ones and dresses them like servants
Collects fingernail clippings of monarchs and engraves herself on them
Defiles holy water for fun
Compulsively paints pictures of women while they sleep
Serious mental problems - punches herself in the face under stress
Addicted to teas from Yoon-Suin
Enjoys executions excessively
Has a peculiar fondness for injured women
Desires the throne at all costs
Has no fingernails
Compulsively shaves women bald
Once was a spy for the Goblin City of Gaxen Kane
Fears to touch the ground
Only finds joy in the sound of innocent women crying. Will go to extreme lengths to establish their innocence
Summons creatures from the lower planes for unsavory purposes
Worships Groan, God of Despair
Asexual
Despises the sound of the voices of all those around him, close to madness
Only derives pleasure from others' fear
Has a paralyzing fear of the Church of Vorn
Believes Voivodja to be a living entity hostile to her, but is afraid to leave
Is possessed by the demon Belphegor
Bathes in the liquified bone of young maidens
Commits adulterous acts on an open field as an offering to the moon goddess
Always tells the truth
Wants revenge on the Church of Vorn for unknown reasons
Addicted to hearing prophecies and predictions
Wants to die but fears the afterworld
Seeks to enslave the Jabberwock
Fears to leave the Interior, for he is haunted by the squealing of the ghosts of hundreds of Mome Raths he has slain
Is a permanently polymorphed goblin
Is 8,000 years old, though she looks 25
Can speak, but hates her voice
Enslaved to a tentacled creature from deep in the Interior in his palatial home
Leads a secret second life as a dancing girl in {{LOCATION_CASTLE}}
Wants to kill her sister
Surprisingly normal
Has precognitive dreams
Despises the sun, even more than usual
Will only wear clothes of the recently deceased
Compulsively steals small animals from the rest of the nobility and keeps them alive and hidden
Seeks the utter destruction of Voivodja
Is a Guest in disguise
Obsessed with acquiring the perfect shoes - will seek out the skins and bones of obscure creatures to create them
Believes that much of the nobility of Voivodja is in thrall to a {{ANIMAL}}
Is blackmailing several other NPCs for gold and favors
Keeps a small but powerful relic concealed inside his cane, but does not know how to activate it
Was in love with someone the PCs killed

NPC_RELATIONSHIP.2: Is toying with {{OBJECT_ANIMAL_ENCOUNTER}} or using it/she/he for entertainment
NPC_RELATIONSHIP.28: Cannot sense {{OBJECT_ANIMAL}} and this is dangerous
NPC_RELATIONSHIP.32: Does not want to harm {{ENCOUNTER_INTELLIGENT}}{{HERE_OR_THERE}} but feels s/he must

NPC_RELATIONSHIP.44: Is being pressured to ally with {{ENCOUNTER_INTELLIGENT}}{{HERE_OR_THERE}}
NPC_RELATIONSHIP.46: Wants to frame {{ENCOUNTER_INTELLIGENT}}{{HERE_OR_THERE}} or otherwise have his/her/its actions mistaken for his/her/its own
NPC_RELATIONSHIP.48: Must distract {{ANIMAL_ENCOUNTER}} at {{LOCATION}} in order to enact plan
NPC_RELATIONSHIP.52: Will be unstoppable once allied with {{ENCOUNTER_INTELLIGENT}}{{HERE_OR_THERE}}
NPC_RELATIONSHIP.54: Will be more vulnerable once allied with {{ENCOUNTER_INTELLIGENT}}{{HERE_OR_THERE}}
NPC_RELATIONSHIP.81: Is or wants to perform experiments on {{ANIMAL_ENCOUNTER}} at {{LOCATION}}{{HERE_OR_THERE}}
NPC_RELATIONSHIP.83: Requires {{OBJECT_ANIMAL}} to complete a work of art
NPC_RELATIONSHIP.93: Is struggling with {{ENCOUNTER_INTELLIGENT}} at {{LOCATION}}{{HERE_OR_THERE}} for control of an organization
NPC_RELATIONSHIP.95: Is unaware of but vulnerable to {{OBJECT_ANIMAL}}

OBJECT: Doll <mark>(or workbox? Hard to tell. It's always in your peripheral vision)</mark>
Worldcube <mark>(like a globe except accurate because we all know the world is cube-shaped) fist-sized</mark>
Key <mark>(Roll d100. That's the percent chance it will fit any given lock. Once it fits a lock, that's the door it was for)</mark>
PERPLEXITY_COMMON: Doors all change position if characters return to this room
Has Anonymity <mark>(roll on Anonymities Table, p150)</mark>
Room tilted, <mark>characters walking through entrance end up walking on wall</mark>
Room inverted, <mark>furniture and door aligned along ceiling, gravity still pulls "down" in same direction on both sides of the door, so characters must climb down to "ceiling"</mark>

Long bent hall or shaft turning left or right. <mark>After all characters have rounded the bend they will find there is no exit. After this happens, roll d4: - 1 An Anonymity appears - 2 Roll another Common Perplexity for this room - 3 Roll an Uncommon Perplexity for this room - 4 Roll a random Interior Encounter for this room. If resolving that doesn't get the characters out of the room, roll d4 again</mark>
All entrances to here are concealed
A battle was just fought here
PERPLEXITY_UNCOMMON: Full of {{OBJECT}}
Full of {{ANIMAL}}
Gravity pulls toward whichever of room's surfaces most of creature is closest to
Inside-out room: like Castle Poenari, room 23
Opposite side of door is another door in the same room. <mark>Example: walk out north, walk into the same room from the east</mark>
Furniture fixed to ceiling<mark>--door not in "correct" place relative to furniture</mark>
Furniture fixed to wall, <mark>roll direction randomly</mark>
Furniture fixed to wall, <mark>roll direction randomly and gravity pulls up</mark>
Furniture fixed to wall, <mark>roll direction randomly and gravity matches furniture</mark>
Multiple doors, gravity always pulls in same direction as last opened door
Window looking out on {{GARDEN_LANDMARK}} of garden
Either the room is enormous or you just shrunk
Furniture contains 3 Anonymities (roll)
Gravity pulls up
Gravity pulls in random compass direction
Wall looks like wood or stone but if something touches it, it ripples. <mark>Swimming through this watery wall reveals hidden room</mark>

Wall looks like wood or stone but if something touches it, it ripples. <mark>Swimming through this watery wall reveals hidden room. With d4 Colorless 1-Pawn(s) 2-Knight(s) 3-Bishop(s) 4-Rook(s) 5-Queen 6-Roll twice lurking behind surface</mark>
Opening this door closes and locks all others
Doors behind do not exist so long as a given door is open
False doors
Room shrinks 4' per round once entered
Everything burned
Chess match paused midway, <mark>2 players in next room smoking</mark>
Game of cards paused midway, <mark>d6+1 players scattered in nearby rooms</mark>
Indoor croquet paused midway, <mark>2d4 players searching nearby for lost ball</mark>
Wargame paused midway, <mark>d4+1 players sleeping nearby</mark>
Cavernous shaftway with bridge across, <mark>bridge has small guardhouse midway across</mark>
Room contains large 3d model of Voivodja in pasteboard or gingerbread
Tall, narrow shaft. <mark>A child or Pawn 2d4 stories up will drop croquet balls or hedgehogs on anyone investigating it</mark>
Tall, narrow shaft. <mark>A child or Pawn 2d4 stories up will drop croquet balls or hedgehogs on anyone investigating it. Morgue or library. Mortician/librarian possibly present</mark>
10' high tightrope to far door. <mark>Touching the floor causes sleep effect</mark>
Filled with marmalade, waist deep
Everything in room is a stage flat, decayed and hastily painted
Great paintings on the walls of various scenes from the Slow War. <mark>Act as portals to those places,: all other creatures are frozen. Items function normally</mark>
Terraced to resemble a 3-dimensional Q*Bert-style chess board
One enormous {{ANIMAL}} stuck in room
Shaft full of croquet balls, access to other levels below. <mark>Strength check per level descended, Constitution per level to avoid d12 damage from suffocation</mark>
Filled with a slurry of pus, gore, vomit and viscera, waist deep

Furnished cube room 40' on a side. <mark>In the floor is a right-angled pit, which is actually a 30' cube, 3/4 scale replica of the original room. Set into the floor of the 30' room is a 3/4 scale replica of the 30' room, and inside that one another and another etc. Looking up from the original room will reveal the 40' room is in a pit set in the floor of an identical, larger room, of which the 40' room is a 3/4 scale model, and that the larger room is set into the floor of a still larger room, etc. Doors function normally & lead to different places</mark>
Empty, cracked swimming pool. <mark>Small {{ANIMAL}}, {{ANIMAL}}, and {{ANIMAL}} trapped at the bottom</mark>
Logic distortions take a toll<mark>--Save vs magic or lose a point of Int until outside again</mark>
{{OBJECT}} in room turns into {{OBJECT}}
{{OBJECT}} in room turns into {{ANIMAL}}
{{ANIMAL}} in room turns into {{OBJECT}}

Inhabitants endlessly attempt to achieve the same immediate objective over and over. <mark>i.e. if they were climbing a ladder they must continue to climb a ladder (going down and starting over if necessary), if speaking, they must keep talking, etc</mark>
Footmen are cleaning this room. Reason unclear
Inhabitants' minds are moved to other creatures' bodies <mark>so long as they are in this room</mark>
Inhabitants' minds are moved to other creatures' bodies <mark>until vessel creature is slain</mark>
Automata precisely resemble player characters
Room stretched out to d100-story shaft

Party sees dead versions of themselves filled with darts at other end of room (near only other exit). <mark>As they move toward center of room, the dead selves rise up and move backward like a rewound tape (at the same speed the party moves forward), poison darts leave their bodies and pull back into concealed barrels and the reverse-party moves back toward tripwires in the center of the room that activated the trap. Those within 2' of the wires searching the center of the room will see them. If a character steps past the wires (or activates them, springing the trap) his/her double crosses past their twin across the wires (exchanging positions) and backwards-walking away at the same speed the character moves forward</mark>
Resembles nearest room in every detail, <mark>replicates all changes to that room, other than presence of characters</mark>
Armies fighting a battle in the room
Room on fire
Totally random creatures emerge every round from one of the doors
Room turns all occupants into children. <mark>They return to normal if they leave</mark>
All surfaces are powerfully adhesive
One wall is composed of glass. <mark>Giants look in through the glass</mark>
Narrow bridge stretches over chasm filled with some Perplexity or mystery<mark>--opposing armies controls either side of the bridge. The far side is not in bow range</mark>
Walls made of glass, <mark>at least on this side</mark>
Close inspection reveals furniture is made of paper
Room freezing cold, floor covered in ice
Room is the back room of a merchant's shop
All furniture on the backs of turtles or short servants
Guest-summoning circle
Windows show an unfamiliar night sky
Ceiling is thick glass. <mark>Enemies above</mark>
Enormous dying snail
Arrow slits coming into room from every wall
Arrow slits coming into room from every wall, <mark>those on opposing walls belong to opposed factions</mark>
Medical files on nearby NPCs and creatures
Biographies of nearby NPCs and creatures

Fleshy grey spheres float in vats and range from grapefruit to cantaloupe size, covered in mouths. <mark>Each mouth whispers all the sins of a specific creature somewhere. Filing system in nearby room</mark>
Room is the backstage of the next room. <mark>Seats in the adjacent room, perhaps occupied, and curtains along the sides</mark>

3' wide corridor going left and right. <mark>"Corridor" is actually an interspace between the last room and a room--3' larger in every direction--it sits inside of. There is a slightly-larger version of anything that was on the walls of the last room. You can climb onto the roof of the previous room</mark>

3' wide corridor going left and right. <mark>"Corridor" is actually an interspace between the last room and a room--3' larger in every direction--it sits inside of. There is a slightly-larger version of anything that was on the walls of the last room. You can climb onto the roof of the previous room. The effect keeps repeating d20 times. Walking out a door on the exterior of a larger room brings you to one with even larger furnishings</mark>
Room spins in relation to rooms around it every time door is used<mark>--4 characters walking out single file will end up in 4 different places</mark>
Tiny cities coat the floor like a thick rug. <mark>This room is their country</mark>
4' ceiling. Soft floor beneath carpet. <mark>Inhabitants are in normal-sized room, standing on a huge pile of wall-to- wall carpets. {{TREASURE}} beneath</mark>
Knee-deep in random junk
Small random object on fire on pedestal
Inoffensive-looking creature. <mark>Personally responsible for all perplexities in the area</mark>
Freshly cooked meal laid out. <mark>Harmless</mark>

Objects <mark>(not including the walls, ceilings, floor or the statues themselves)</mark> immediately disappear from the room if the statues in the room cannot see them or something they are touching. <mark>Disappeared things appear in another room. It's possible to remove locked doors or other obstacles by blocking the statues' vision. A painting here reflects the aggregate of what all the statues can currently see in the room</mark>
Room is bottom of 200' shaft. Things strewn about
Maze corridors. <mark>If the characters keep going forward for 2 minutes they'll get out, but if they turn back they will find tigers behind the first turn</mark>
Old, happily married version of random party member with kids occupies room. <mark>Implores party to stay</mark>
Prep room for terrified cook or chef <mark>frantically preparing scones, shrewsbury cakes, etc. for a ravenous nearby Rook</mark>
Larder for anthrovorous beast. <mark>Hogtied men and women in cubby holes</mark>

Gender swapped versions of party are fighting gender- swapped versions of some recent foes in this room. <mark>Characters have to play gender-swapped versions of themselves to go further in this direction, but will turn back to their original selves once they come back through</mark>
Replica of room from a long-ago incident in the campaign
Gender-changed-, child-, or aged- version of character challenges character to a duel. <mark>Player must play the new character if s/he loses</mark>
Small doppleganger begins following characters<mark>-- taking notes on their abilities and voice tics, spells, combat tactics, etc. It has no immediate plan to attack</mark>
Shoes tastefully displayed. <mark>Obsequious {{ENCOUNTER_INTELLIGENT}} appears and attempt to sell them to the party, commenting on the worn quality of their current footwear</mark>

{{ENCOUNTER_INTELLIGENT}} owns puppets of major political forces and monsters in Voivodja. <mark>For 2 gp, s/he will put on a puppet show featuring a creature of the customer's choice. The show will be silent but the events portrayed will be wholly accurate</mark>
Talking sloth seeks to book passage on character to nearby room. Will pay
Museum room<mark>--displays explain various facts about the Place in Old Voivodish</mark>
Room offers a view of-, but no direct passage to-, events in a nearby room

Gingerbread maze matching layout of nearby fortified rooms<mark>--eating walls or floors will destroy the real rooms or floors in the complex and throw the enemy into disarray. The gingerbread maze has no figures or other markers clarifying the relationship to the real rooms</mark>

3' pool with 6" wide canals extending through the walls into various other rooms in the interior. <mark>The pool is filled with messages in bottles. Senders' names clearly visible from outside the bottles. Read any note and the others are gone next time you look down</mark>
